intro: Dothilophis purpurea, commonly known as the purple-leafed strobilanthes, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking purple foliage and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its unique coloration and floral display.
